001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JavaType;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;
006
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
010import java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException;
011import java.util.function.Supplier;
012
013/**
014 * Interface with default methods for a strongly-typed JSON-RPC client that uses Jackson to map from JSON to Java Objects.
015 */
016public interface JacksonRpcClient extends JsonRpcClient {
017
018    ObjectMapper getMapper();
019
020    JavaType getDefaultType();
021
022    default JavaType responseTypeFor(JavaType resultType) {
023        return getMapper().getTypeFactory().
024                constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, resultType);
025    }
026
027    default JavaType responseTypeFor(Class<?> resultType) {
028        return getMapper().getTypeFactory().
029                constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, resultType);
030    }
031
032    default JavaType typeForClass(Class<?> clazz) {
033        return getMapper().constructType(clazz);
034    }
035
036    /**
037     * Send a {@link JsonRpcRequest} for a {@link JsonRpcResponse}
038     * <p>Synchronous subclasses should override this method to prevent {@link CompletableFuture#supplyAsync(Supplier)} from
039     * being called twice when {@link AsyncSupport} is being used. Eventually we'll migrate more of the codebase to native
040     * async, and then we won't have to worry about calling {@code supplyAsync} twice.
041     * @param <R> Type of result object
042     * @param request The request to send
043     * @param responseType The response type expected (used by Jackson for conversion)
044     * @return A JSON RPC Response with `result` of type `R`
045     * @throws IOException network error
046     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status error
047     */
048    default <R> JsonRpcResponse<R> sendRequestForResponse(JsonRpcRequest request, JavaType responseType) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
049        try {
050            return (JsonRpcResponse<R>) sendRequestForResponseAsync(request, responseType).get();
051        } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
052            throw new RuntimeException(ie);
053        } catch (ExecutionException ee) {
054            Throwable cause = ee.getCause();
055            if (cause instanceof JsonRpcStatusException) {
056                throw (JsonRpcStatusException) cause;
057            } else if (cause instanceof IOException) {
058                throw (IOException) cause;
059            } else {
060                throw new RuntimeException(ee);
061            }
062        }
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Send a {@link JsonRpcRequest} for a {@link JsonRpcResponse} asynchronously.
067     * @param <R> Type of result object
068     * @param request The request to send
069     * @param responseType The response type expected (used by Jackson for conversion)
070     * @return A future JSON RPC Response with `result` of type `R`
071     */
072    <R> CompletableFuture<JsonRpcResponse<R>> sendRequestForResponseAsync(JsonRpcRequest request, JavaType responseType);
073
074    /**
075     * Convenience method for requesting a response with a {@link JsonNode} for the result.
076     * @param request The request to send
077     * @return A JSON RPC Response with `result` of type {@code JsonNode}
078     * @throws IOException network error
079     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status error
080     */
081    default JsonRpcResponse<JsonNode> sendRequestForResponse(JsonRpcRequest request) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
082        return sendRequestForResponse(request, responseTypeFor(JsonNode.class));
083    }
084
085    private <R> R sendRequestForResult(JsonRpcRequest request, JavaType resultType) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
086        JsonRpcResponse<R> response = sendRequestForResponse(request, responseTypeFor(resultType));
087
088//        assert response != null;
089//        assert response.getJsonrpc() != null;
090//        assert response.getJsonrpc().equals("2.0");
091//        assert response.getId() != null;
092//        assert response.getId().equals(request.getId());
093
094        if (response.getError() != null && response.getError().getCode() != 0) {
095            throw new JsonRpcStatusException(
096                    response.getError().getMessage(),
097                    200,    // If response code wasn't 200 we couldn't be here
098                    null,
099                    response.getError().getCode(),
100                    null,
101                    response);
102        }
103        return response.getResult();
104    }
105    
106    /**
107     * JSON-RPC remote method call that returns 'response.result`
108     *
109     * @param <R> Type of result object
110     * @param method JSON RPC method call to send
111     * @param resultType desired result type as a Java class object
112     * @param params JSON RPC params
113     * @return the 'response.result' field of the JSON RPC response converted to type R
114     */
115    @Override
116    default <R> R send(String method, Class<R> resultType, List<Object> params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
117        // Construct a JavaType object so we can tell Jackson what type of result we are expecting.
118        // (We can't use R because of type erasure)
119//        JavaType responseType = mapper.getTypeFactory().
120//                constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, resultType);
121        return sendRequestForResult(buildJsonRequest(method, params), typeForClass(resultType));
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * JSON-RPC remote method call that returns 'response.result`
126     *
127     * @param <R> Type of result object
128     * @param method JSON RPC method call to send
129     * @param resultType desired result type as a Jackson JavaType object
130     * @param params JSON RPC params
131     * @return the 'response.result' field of the JSON RPC response converted to type R
132     */
133    default <R> R send(String method, JavaType resultType, List<Object> params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
134        // Construct a JavaType object so we can tell Jackson what type of result we are expecting.
135        // (We can't use R because of type erasure)
136        //JavaType responseType = mapper.getTypeFactory().
137        //        constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, resultType);
138        return sendRequestForResult(buildJsonRequest(method, params), resultType);
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Varargs version
143     */
144    default <R> R send(String method, JavaType resultType, Object... params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
145        return sendRequestForResult(buildJsonRequest(method, params), resultType);
146    }
147
148    /**
149     * Call an RPC method and return default object type.
150     *
151     * Caller should cast returned object to the correct type.
152     *
153     * Useful for:
154     * * Dynamically-dispatched JSON-RPC methods calls via Groovy subclasses
155     * * Simple (not client-side validated) command line utilities
156     * * Functional tests that need to send incorrect types to the server to test error handling
157     *
158     * @param <R> Type of result object
159     * @param method JSON RPC method call to send
160     * @param params JSON RPC parameters as a `List`
161     * @return the 'response.result' field of the JSON RPC response cast to type R
162     * @throws IOException network error
163     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status error
164     */
165    @Override
166    default <R> R send(String method, List<Object> params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
167        return send(method, getDefaultType(), params);
168    }
169}
